articles.title: Kim Yong Sun meets Italian guest
articles.content:
Kim Yong Sun meets Italian guest

   Pyongyang, January 5 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong sun, secretary of 
the central committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and 
chairman of the Korean Asia-pacific Peace Committee, on 
Saturday met and had a friendly conversation with Giancarlo 
Elia Valori, secretary general of the Italian Institute of 
International Relations.

articles.title: Kim Young Sam group urged to nullify fascist laws
articles.content:
Kim Young Sam group urged to nullify fascist laws
  Pyongyang, January 5 (KCNA) -- Spokesmen for the central 
committees of the General Federation of the Unions of 
Literature and Art and the Korean Journalists Union released 
statements on January 3 denouncing the Kim Young Sam group 
for ruthlessly cracking down upon the struggle of South 
Korean workers and people against the revised "Laws on the 
agency for national security planning" and the "Labour 
affairs".
   The spokesman for the C.C., the General Federation of 
the Unions of Literature and Art of Korea denounced the Kim 
Young Sam group's brutal crackdown as an unpardonable 
criminal act which adds to the anti-national crime committed 
by them by railroading evil laws through the "National 
assembly".
   The way for the South Korean workers and people to enjoy 
a genuine life is to fight uninterruptedly for the overthrow 
of the Kim Young Sam group,  the statement said.
   The spokesman for the C.C., the Korean Journalists Union 
said:
   The Kim Young Sam group are alleging that the amendment 
was inevitable for "The improvement of the toiling people's 
living" and the revised laws "reflect the present situation 
under which the north and the south stand opposed to each 
other." But, with no sophism can they conceal their 
despicable nature as the fascist fanatics and truculent 
enemy of the nation.
   The statement urged the Kim Young Sam group to nullify 
the revised fascist laws at once as demanded by the South 
Korean people.

articles.title: Postcard carrying reverence for Pres. Kim Il Sung issued in s. Korea
articles.content:
Postcard carrying reverence for Pres. Kim Il Sung issued in S. Korea
   Pyongyang, January 5 (KCNA) -- Members of the April 15 
Fellowship Society active in all parts of South Korea issued 
postcards praying for the immortality of the great leader 
president Kim Il Sung on the New Year and distributed them 
to many people, the Seoul-based radio Voice of National 
Salvation quoted the information of the South Korean kangwon 
provincial committee of the national democratic front of 
South Korea as saying.
   Printed in the upper part of the front of the postcards 
sent by mail is a picture of President Kim Il Sung beaming 
with a bright smile.
   Also printed in its front are words saying that the 
undying exploits recorded by President Kim Il Sung in the 
nation's history will shine forever along with the 
history and letters sincerely praying for the immortality of 
the president, the eternal father of the seventy million 
fellow countrymen and the eternal sun of the Korean nation.
   Appearing in their reverse are words of a Song "We hold 
him in high esteem as the eternal sun" and its note against 
the background of the Kumsusan Memorial Palace in which 
President Kim Il Sung is preserved in state.

articles.title: It is noble duty of Korean people tto defend socialism
articles.content:
It is noble duty of Korean people tto defend socialism
   Pyongyang, January 5 (KCNA) -- To defend socialism is 
the road of victory, glory and happiness and to abandon 
socialism means death, stresses Rodong sinmun in a by-lined 
article today.  The daily says:
   To defend the Korean-style socialism is first of all a 
sacred work for safeguarding the benevolent administration 
that respects the dignity and personality of man to the 
fullest. Whether our socialism is defended or not decides 
that we are dignified as an independent people, or not 
dignified as slaves.
   We, mindful that defending socialism is the way of 
defending the dignity of man and abandoning it turns 
ourselves into slaves, should defend at cost of our lives 
the grateful socialist system, which has made the Korean 
people, who had once groaned as a ruined nation, very 
dignified.
   To defend our socialism is also essential for all the 
members of society to bring into full bloom the beautiful 
life of helping and leading each other, with the society 
forming a large harmonious whole.
   Our socialism is a large family where all the people 
value and love each other like their own brothers, holding 
the respected general Kim Jong Il in high esteem as their 
father.
   We should firmly defend our socialism, clearly seeing 
through the corruptness of capitalist society.
   Defending our socialism is the way of maintaining the 
noble spiritual world of man and making the whole country 
replete with a beautiful life full of love and trust, while 
abandoning socialism inevitably results in putting the 
people on the altar of all crimes and social evils.
   To defend our socialism is also a proud cause of 
safeguarding what enables all the people to enjoy a sound 
and bountiful life.

articles.title: Japan's moves to revive militarism
articles.content:
Japan's moves to revive militarism
   Pyongyang, January 5 (KCNA) -- Official circles of Japan 
decided to conduct an active campaign for fixing the visit 
to Yasukuni Shrine. Commenting on this fact, Rodong sinmun 
today brands it as part of their dangerous moves to spread 
militarism over Japanese society.
   The news analyst goes on:
   The Japanese reactionaries are describing the dead in the 
past aggression and war as "Patriotic Martyrs" and 
"Internationalist soldiers" who fought for "Self-defence" 
and "Justice". This is a shameless distortion of history and 
a mockery of justice and human conscience.
   The rightists of the liberal democratic party of Japan 
are trying to fix the visit of the prime minister and 
ministers to Yasukuni Shrine. This is a scheme to 
regularize, legalize and socialize the visit.
   The Japanese reactionaries must give up the reckless 
moves to revive militarism.

articles.title: New Year greetings to Secy. Kim Jong Il from Jimmy Carter
articles.content:
New Year greetings to Secy. Kim Jong Il from Jimmy Carter
  Pyongyang, January 5 (KCNA) -- A message of greetings was 
sent to the great leader comrade Kim Jong Il by former U.S. 
President Jimmy Carter on the new year 1997.
   The message, dated December 31, says he and his wife 
extend the warmest greetings to his excellency Kim Jong Il 
and his family on the occasion.
   It also says he discussed many matters of mutual 
understanding and concern with president Kim Il Sung at a 
meeting in Pyongyang in 1994.
   It expresses the hope that this will be a year of great 
progress in the DPRK under his excellency Kim Jong Il's 
leadership.
